recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Puran Poli is a traditional Maharashtrian sweet dish made during festive occasions. Puran is the stuffing and poli is the outer covering which is nothing but roti.

The roti is stuffed with chana dal and jaggery mixture. The dish has many variations in different parts of India. The stuffing is made with moong dal , chana dal, toor daal or sometimes a mix of lentils. The outer covering is made with wheat flour but it can be made by mixing maida in 50:50 ratio.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Wash chana dal two times under running water. Add 2 cups along with chana dal and pressure cook upto 2 whistles.

Once it cools down, make a smooth paste then add powdered jaggery and mix well. Cook it on a medium flame until the mixture is completely dry. Add 2 tbsp of ghee and cardamom powder and fry on low flame for 2 mins or till the mixture starts leaving the side of a pan. Keep it aside to cool down.
To make dough, in a bowl add wheat flour and salt and mix it well. Add water little by little and make it into soft dough. Allow it to rest for 15 mins.

Take a small ball of dough and roll it into small round shape.Take equal amount of stuffing, roll it into small ball and place it on the poli. Carefully seal the puran. Dust a little wheat flour over the stuffed ball and keep rolling it into a size of a roti. Make similar polis with the remaining stuffing.
On a medium pan, heat puran poli. Flip it when one side is cooked. Apply generous amount of ghee on both sides and cook it for 30 seconds.

tips.tipDesc: The sweetness can be adjusted by jaggery as per required taste.
For healthier reason, use wheat flour instead of maida.
Using ghee in the puran , keeps it intact while rolling. You can avoid using it too.
